content:
Can you provide a JSON code that can retrieve information about rare movie titles released before 1960, including their plot, historical context, and themes explored? The list should include at least 10 movies. Here is the Python code that can be used as a reference:
```python
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
url = "https://www.imdb.com/search/title?release_date=1900-01-01,1960-12-31&sort=num_votes,desc&start="
page = 1
movies = []
while page <= 200:
    req = requests.get(url + str(page))
    soup = BeautifulSoup(req.text, "html.parser")
    
    for movie in soup.select(".lister-item-header a"):
        title = movie.text
        year = movie.next_sibling.next_sibling.text
        if int(year[1:-1]) < 1960:
            movies.append(title)
    
    page += 50
movie_info = []
for movie in movies[:10]:
    movie_data = {}
    query = "https://www.omdbapi.com/?t=" + movie.replace(" ", "+") + "&apikey=yourapikey"
    req = requests.get(query)
    data = req.json()
    
    movie_data["title"] = data["Title"]
    movie_data["plot"] = data["Plot"]
    movie_data["year"] = data["Year"]
    movie_data["genre"] = data["Genre"]
    movie_data["director"] = data["Director"]
    movie_data["actors"] = data["Actors"]
    
    movie_info.append(movie_data)
print(movie_info)
```
Please provide the JSON data in the format of a list of dictionaries, where each dictionary contains information about a single movie.

Certainly! Below is a sample JSON representation of rare movie titles released before 1960, including details like their plot, historical context, and themes explored. This is a hypothetical dataset based on common classic films from the era:

```json
[
    {
        "title": "Casablanca",
        "plot": "A cynical American expatriate struggles to decide whether or not he should help his former lover and her fugitive husband escape French Morocco.",
        "year": "1942",
        "genre": "Drama, Romance, War",
        "director": "Michael Curtiz",
        "actors": "Humphrey Bogart, Ingrid Bergman, Paul Henreid",
        "historical_context": "Set during World War II, the film explores themes of love and sacrifice amidst the backdrop of war.",
        "themes": ["Love", "Sacrifice", "War", "Courage"]
    },
    {
        "title": "Gone with the Wind",
        "plot": "A manipulative woman and a roguish man conduct a turbulent romance during the American Civil War and Reconstruction periods.",
        "year": "1939",
        "genre": "Drama, History, Romance",
        "director": "Victor Fleming",
        "actors": "Clark Gable, Vivien Leigh, Thomas Mitchell",
        "historical_context": "Set against the backdrop of the American Civil War and Reconstruction era.",
        "themes": ["Survival", "Social Change", "Romance"]
    },
    {
        "title": "The Third Man",
        "plot": "Pulp novelist Holly Martins travels to shadowy, postwar Vienna, only to find himself investigating the mysterious death of an old friend, Harry Lime.",
        "year": "1949",
        "genre": "Film-Noir, Mystery, Thriller",
        "director": "Carol Reed",
        "actors": "Orson Welles, Joseph Cotten, Alida Valli",
        "historical_context": "Post-World War II Europe, focusing on the divided city of Vienna.",
        "themes": ["Betrayal", "Moral Ambiguity", "Corruption"]
    },
    {
        "title": "Citizen Kane",
        "plot": "Following the death of publishing tycoon Charles Foster Kane, reporters scramble to uncover the meaning of his final utterance; 'Rosebud'.",
        "year": "1941",
        "genre": "Drama, Mystery",
        "director": "Orson Welles",
        "actors": "Orson Welles, Joseph Cotten, Dorothy Comingore",
        "historical_context": "A fictionalized biography reflecting the rise and fall of American media magnates.",
        "themes": ["Power", "Loss", "Media Influence"]
    },
    {
        "title": "Sunset Boulevard",
        "plot": "A screenwriter develops a dangerous relationship with a faded film star determined to make a triumphant return.",
        "year": "1950",
        "genre": "Drama, Film-Noir",
        "director": "Billy Wilder",
        "actors": "William Holden, Gloria Swanson, Erich von Stroheim",
        "historical_context": "Explores the decline of Hollywood's silent film era and the transition to talkies.",
        "themes": ["Fame", "Obsession", "Hollywood"]
    },
    {
        "title": "12 Angry Men",
        "plot": "A jury holdout attempts to prevent a miscarriage of justice by forcing his colleagues to reconsider the evidence.",
        "year": "1957",
        "genre": "Drama",
        "director": "Sidney Lumet",
        "actors": "Henry Fonda, Lee J. Cobb, Martin Balsam",
        "historical_context": "Reflects on the American justice system and civil rights issues.",
        "themes": ["Justice", "Prejudice", "Reason"]
    },
    {
        "title": "Rear Window",
        "plot": "A wheelchair-bound photographer spies on his neighbors from his apartment window and becomes convinced one of them has committed murder.",
        "year": "1954",
        "genre": "Mystery, Thriller",
        "director": "Alfred Hitchcock",
        "actors": "James Stewart, Grace Kelly, Wendell Corey",
        "historical_context": "Post-war urban America, reflecting on voyeurism and privacy.",
        "themes": ["Voyeurism", "Isolation", "Suspicion"]
    },
    {
        "title": "The Bridge on the River Kwai",
        "plot": "British POWs are forced to build a railway bridge across the river Kwai for their Japanese captors.",
        "year": "1957",
        "genre": "Adventure, Drama, War",
        "director": "David Lean",
        "actors": "William Holden, Alec Guinness, Jack Hawkins",
        "historical_context": "Based on World War II events, focusing on the Burma Railway.",
        "themes": ["Honor", "War Ethics", "Madness"]
    },
    {
        "title": "Vertigo",
        "plot": "A former police detective juggles wrestling with his personal demons and becoming obsessed with a hauntingly beautiful woman.",
        "year": "1958",
        "genre": "Mystery, Romance, Thriller",
        "director": "Alfred Hitchcock",
        "actors": "James Stewart, Kim Novak, Barbara Bel Geddes",
        "historical_context": "Explores psychological themes and the concept of identity in post-war America.",
        "themes": ["Obsession", "Identity", "Fear of Heights"]
    },
    {
        "title": "Some Like It Hot",
        "plot": "When two musicians witness a mob hit, they flee the state in an all-female band disguised as women, but further complications set in.",
        "year": "1959",
        "genre": "Comedy, Romance",
        "director": "Billy Wilder",
        "actors": "Marilyn Monroe, Tony Curtis, Jack Lemmon",
        "historical_context": "Set during the Prohibition era, reflecting on gender roles and identity.",
        "themes": ["Identity", "Disguise", "Love"]
    }
]
```

This JSON format provides a structured way to capture the essential details of each movie, including their themes and historical context, which are integral for a deeper understanding of these classic films.
